reasoning: Interstitial nephritis (tubulointerstitial nephritis) accounts for ~5-10% of acute kidney injury cases. Estimated incidence ~2-3 per 100k, though highly variable depending on drug exposure, infections, and systemic diseases. Limited epidemiological data for general population.
source: Perazella MA. (2005). Drug-induced renal failure: update on new medications and unique mechanisms of nephrotoxicity. Am J Med Sci. 329(6):372-379
